definition: to file a lawsuit/to sue/to dispute
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: Henry took it to avoid the crushing legal expense of a long trial.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避免長期打官司的鉅額訴訟費，亨利接受了。

sentences.english: He was a barrister of Philadelphia, but became far more renowned by his gun than by his law cases.
sentences.chinese: 他是費城的律師，但他打官司遠不及打槍出名。

sentences.english: But she just can’t live with the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 但是她還是受不了這樣天天打官司的生活。

sentences.english: Elsewhere they have gone to court for the blunt-nosed leopard lizard and the giant kangaroo rat.
sentences.chinese: 在別處，他們爲鈍鼻蜥蜴和更格盧鼠打官司。

sentences.english: She said no more energy and money to litigate.
sentences.chinese: 她說再也沒有精力和錢去打官司了。

sentences.english: If she gets that far, Jane may get legal aid to take her case to court.
sentences.chinese: 如果走到那個地步，簡也許能得到法律援助去打官司。

sentences.english: We are incompetent, sell tea can, to engage in a lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 是我們無能，賣涼茶可以，打官司不行。

definition: public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
to face legal action/to get sued
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
to sue/to take to court/to file a lawsuit
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
to ask for compensation/to claim damages/claim for damages
